title: Sure, here is a reading list of 20 articles published before 2022 that cover various aspects of using crowdsourcing for data annotation, particularly in the context of natural language processing (NLP). This list includes articles on methodologies
note: tools, and case studies, including those where annotators have unconstrained work.

title: Cheap and fast—but is it good? Evaluating non-expert annotations for natural language tasks
container-title: *Proceedings of the Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP)*

title: Creating speech and language data with Amazon’s Mechanical Turk
container-title: *Proceedings of the NAACL HLT 2010 Workshop on Creating Speech and Language Data with Amazon’s Mechanical Turk*

title: Crowdsourcing research opportunities: Lessons from natural language processing
container-title: *Proceedings of the 12th International Conference on Knowledge Management and Knowledge Technologies*

title: Data quality from crowdsourcing: A study of annotation selection criteria
container-title: *Proceedings of the NAACL HLT 2009 Workshop on Active Learning for Natural Language Processing*

title: Quality management on Amazon Mechanical Turk
container-title: *Proceedings of the ACM SIGKDD Workshop on Human Computation (HCOMP)*

title: Crowdsourcing user studies with Mechanical Turk
container-title: *Proceedings of the SIGCHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems*

title: Human computation
container-title: *Synthesis Lectures on Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning*

title: Running experiments on Amazon Mechanical Turk
container-title: *Judgment and Decision Making*

title: Get another label? Improving data quality and data mining using multiple, noisy labelers
container-title: *Proceedings of the 14th ACM SIGKDD International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining*

title: Cheap and fast—but is it good? Evaluating non-expert annotations for natural language tasks
container-title: *Proceedings of the Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing (EMNLP)*

title: Making better use of the crowd: How crowdsourcing can advance machine learning research
container-title: *Journal of Machine Learning Research*

title: Managing crowdsourcing workers
container-title: *Proceedings of the 2011 Winter Conference on Business Intelligence*

title: Crowdsourcing translation: Professional quality from non-professionals
container-title: *Proceedings of the 49th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics: Human Language Technologies*

title: Active learning and crowd-sourcing for machine translation
container-title: *Proceedings of the Seventh International Conference on Language Resources and Evaluation (LREC)*

title: Soylent: A word processor with a crowd inside
container-title: *Proceedings of the 23nd Annual ACM Symposium on User Interface Software and Technology*

title: Phrase detectives: A web-based collaborative annotation game
container-title: *Proceedings of the International Conference on Semantic Systems*

title: The social impact of natural language processing
container-title: *Proceedings of the 54th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (Volume 2: Short Papers)*

title: CrowdForge: Crowdsourcing complex work
container-title: *Proceedings of the 24th Annual ACM Symposium on User Interface Software and Technology*

container-title: *Proceedings of the Text REtrieval Conference (TREC)*

container-title: *Proceedings of the 12th International Conference on Knowledge Management and Knowledge Technologies*

title: These articles should provide a comprehensive overview of the use of crowdsourcing for data annotation in NLP, including methodologies, tools, and case studies
